intro: Calonemorchis flaccida, commonly known as the flaccid calonemorchis, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like foliage and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires careful cultivation due to its particular ecological needs. Its botanical significance lies in its role as an indicator species for undisturbed tropical habitats. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
